fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Agriculture, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Culture and media, Budget, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Culture, International co-operation and development, Customs, Education and training, Enlargement, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Public Health, Food Safety, Digital economy and society, Transport, Climate Action, Borders and Security, Communication, Banking and financial services, Migration and asylum, European Neighbourhood Policy, Fraud prevention
eu_initiatives: We are preparing a submission on the Strategy for Long-term EU Greenhouse Gas emissions Reductions (deadline October 9 2018)
organisation_name: The Foundation for the Economics of Sustainability (Feasta)
section: IV - Think tanks, research and academic institutions
membership:
Irish Environmental Network 
Stop Climate Chaos
relevant_communication:
We have made a number of submissions to the Irish government which discuss climate change mitigation strategies. Recent submissions include:  
 
- Submission on the Common Agricultural Policy, March 2018: http://www.feasta.org/2018/03/23/feasta-submission-on-the-post-2020-common-agricultural-policy-consultation-process/ 
- Submission to the Irish National Planning Framework, November 2017: http://www.feasta.org/2017/11/13/feasta-submission-to-the-irish-national-planning-framework-for-2040/  
- Submission on the bioeconomy (to an Irish government interdepartmental group), September 2017: http://www.feasta.org/2017/09/15/submission-on-the-irish-bioeconomy/ 
- Submission to the (Irish) Citizens' Assembly on Climate, August 2017: http://www.feasta.org/2017/08/11/submission-to-the-citizens-assembly/
goals__remit: Feasta aims to identify the characteristics (economic, cultural and environmental) of a truly sustainable society, articulate how the necessary transition can be effected and promote the implementation of the measures required for this purpose.
